contentrichtext.text: [[Image:Randallkennedybook.jpg|thumb|''Nigger: The Strange Career of a Troublesome Word'']] '''''Nigger: The Strange Career of a Troublesome Word''''' is a 2002 book by Professor [[Randall Kennedy]] of [[Harvard Law School]] about the history and sociology of the word "''[[nigger (word)|nigger]]''". The book was prominently featured in an episode of ''[[Boston Public]]'' in which a white teacher, played by [[Michael Rapaport]], attempted to employ the book to teach his students about the history and controversy surrounding the word. == Further reading == * [http://books.google.com/books?id=VgVzXgUxFB4C&printsec=frontcover ''Nigger: The Strange Career of a Troublesome Word''] - online book preview at [[Google Books]]. ISBN 0-375-42172-6. ==External links== *[http://www.popmatters.com/books/reviews/n/nigger.shtml PopMatters review] by James Withers * [http://www.blackcommentator.com/n_word.html "The N-Word as Therapy for Racists]" by Dr. Martin Kilson * [http://www.booknotes.org/Watch/168015-1/Randall+Kennedy.aspx ''Booknotes'' interview with Kennedy on ''Nigger'', March 3, 2002.] * [http://www.guardian.co.uk/Columnists/Column/0,,628643,00.html Not While Racism Exists], by [[Gary Younge]] [[Category:2002 books]] [[Category:Books in semantics]] [[Category:African-American culture]] {{sociology-book-stub}} {{lang-book-stub}} {{AfricanAmerican-stub}}
